definition: to listen to stories/to listen to performance of 說書|说书 storytelling
(literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow
to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]

sentences.english: Try a book on tape or some favorite music while you walk.
sentences.chinese: 走路時嘗試下用耳朵聽書或者聽一些你喜歡的音樂。

sentences.english: The car can be a great place for listening to books or practicing a foreign language.
sentences.chinese: 車是聽書音頻或者聯繫外語的好地方。

definition: (of a pupil) to write down (in a dictation exercise)/dictation/(music) to transcribe by ear
to bury oneself in work (idiom); to be engrossed in work/to make an all-out effort/up to the neck in work
to raise a lantern and fight at night (idiom); fig. to work into the night/to burn the midnight oil
to make do in difficult circumstances by being resourceful/(of circumstances) difficult/challenging/(of a budget) tight/(of a man-made thing) makeshift/rough and ready
